results.title: Earliest times to 1066
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “English History”.
This film discusses the building of Anglo-Saxon England, with emphasis on the many different peoples and cultures which contribute to the development of the English nation. This film uses authentic landmarks and historical material from 1900 B.C. to 1000 A.D. as well as brief re-enactments of important historical events to give a compressed picture of England and its people before the Norman Conquest.

results.title: The Romantic period
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “English Literature”.
Illustrates the literary and political revolution that occurred in the early part of the nineteenth century. Dramatised selections from Burns, Wordsworth, Coleridge, Blake, Byron, Shelley, Keats and Scott reveal the individuality and independence of spirit of England’s Romantic writers.

results.title: The Victorian period
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “English Literature”.
Recreates the atmosphere of 19th century England as a background to the writings of men and women of that period. Presents extracts from the works of Macauley, Darwin, Huxley, Newman, Dickens, the Bronte sisters, Hardy, Arnold, Ruskin and Carroll. Mentions the industrial revolution and new scientific discoveries as prominent features in the writings of these people.

results.title: Norman Conquest to the fifteenth century
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “English History”.
Presents an overall view of medieval England from the Norman Conquest in 1066 to the decline of feudalism during the time of Henry V. Discusses the limited monarchy as the basis of the English form of democracy and explains the importance of trial by jury and the Magna Carta in the recognition and growth of human rights in Britain.

results.title: Chaucer and the Medieval Period
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “English Literature”.
Provides a background for the study of medieval English literature. Identifies the early literary forms - the ballad, mystery play, allegory and romance - and shows how each of these was an expression of different aspects of medieval society. Re-enactments of portions of the Canterbury Tales; Piers Plowman; Sir Gawain and the Green Knight; Morte d’Arthur, illustrate the variety and vigor with which medieval literature is endowed. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Tudor period
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “English History”
Covering the period of English history from 1485 to 1603, this film treats the growth of the National State under Henry VIII and the rise of England as a leading world power during the reign of Elizabeth. Concludes with the emerging of English culture at the height of the Elizabethan period and its influence in America.

results.title: What makes clouds
results.creator_credit: Warren Brown, Stanley Croner, Frederic Goodich and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Earth science series”.
Fogs and cloud are composed of droplets of water. This film conducts an experiment with condensation producing fog in a bottle and concludes with an investigation of how condensation occurs in nature.

results.title: Hurricane below
results.creator_credit: United States. National Aeronautics Space Administration and Screenscope
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Earth science series”.
Shows how NASA provides early weather warning data from space observations to reduce casualties and property loss from natural disasters such as hurricanes, floods and tornadoes. Includes emotional interviews with people who have lost their homes in a hurricane and shows the devastating aftermath hurricanes can cause.
